TEXT: CARDINAL . By a penal order of DATE , the applicant was fined MONEY ( ORG ) for an assault on his wife that did not incapacitate her from work . On DATE he applied to ORG to have that order set aside .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was served by a court bailiff with a summons requiring him to attend ORG on DATE to answer a charge of “ intentional assault entailing no unfitness for work ” on DATE . The offence was classified as a “ Class CARDINAL minor offence ” and carried a maximum fine of ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL under LAW of LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a legal - aid application with the legal - aid office of the GPE tribunal de grande instance , in accordance with the provisions of LAW of DATE and its implementing decree of DATE .

CARDINAL . He furnished evidence , which the legal - aid office accepted , that his DATE income was ORG CARDINAL . In accordance with section CARDINAL of the CARDINAL Act , he claimed to be entitled to full legal aid .

CARDINAL . A committee of the legal - aid office presided over by NORP ( as attested by a letter of DATE from the registry of the GPE tribunal de grande instance ) dismissed the application on DATE as being “ manifestly inadmissible , since it concern[ed ] a Class CARDINAL minor offence ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against that decision to the President of the GPE tribunal de grande instance .

He said that in a similar case the GPE tribunal de grande instance had construed the decree differently and granted legal aid . In an order of CARDINAL DATE , the GPE tribunal de grande instance had noted a conflict between the decree and the LAW and stated that to resolve it the decree had to be construed in the light of the purpose of the LAW .

CARDINAL . The appeal was heard by NORP , now sitting in his capacity as the President of the GPE tribunal de grande instance . He upheld the impugned decision in an order of CARDINAL DATE , against which NORP law afforded no right of appeal ( section CARDINAL , sub - paragraph CARDINAL , of the LAW DATE ) .
He gave a number of reasons for dismissing the applicant ’s appeal :

“ ... although section CARDINAL of the aforementioned LAW [ of DATE ] provides that ‘ legal aid shall be granted ... before all courts’ ... , it does not require it to be granted in all types of proceedings .

... the table appended to LAW and to which the decree refers for the calculation of counsel ’s remuneration only contemplates an accused receiving assistance in the police court for Class CARDINAL minor offences .
... that restriction can not be due to an oversight on the part of the public authorities .
... it is not for either the legal - aid office or the president of the court concerned unilaterally to extend the scope of rules in respect of which no appeal has been made to the ORG d’Etat .
... it is perfectly clear that the relevant table is restrictive in scope . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , assisted by a lawyer , attended the hearing at ORG . In a judgment delivered that DATE , the court found him guilty of assault entailing no unfitness for work , but decided not to impose a penalty .
CARDINAL . LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL of DATE ) provides :
“ Natural persons whose means are insufficient to enable them to assert their rights in the courts may be granted legal aid . ... ”
“ In order to qualify for full legal aid , applicants must show that their DATE resources are MONEY . ”
“ Legal aid shall be granted for both contentious and uncontentious proceedings , to bring or to defend a claim before all courts or in connection with the hearing of a minor in accordance with LAW .
“ Each legal - aid office or department thereof referred to in LAW shall be presided over by a judge from the seat of the tribunal de grande instance or court of appeal , as the case may be .

“ The decisions of a legal - aid office , a department thereof or the president of the office or department may be referred to the president of the tribunal de grande instance , court of appeal or ORG , as the case may be , ... or his or her delegate .
No appeal shall lie against the decisions of these authorities .
CARDINAL . Decree no . CARDINAL of DATE implementing PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE provides , inter alia :
“ Decisions of offices established at the seat of a tribunal de grande instance ... shall be referred to the president of the tribunal de grande instance where the office was set up .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the decree stipulates that the ORG ’s contribution to the remuneration of lawyers acting for recipients of full legal aid shall be determined by reference to a series of criteria set out in a table appended to the decree . The sole reference in the table to the category of “ proceedings for minor offences ” is “ assistance to the accused in the police court ( Class CARDINAL ) ” .
CARDINAL . A bill on access to the law and justice , intended to reform , inter alia , the legal - aid system , is currently before ORG .

CARDINAL . There have been no decisions of ORG on the grant of legal aid to persons prosecuted for minor offences not falling into Class CARDINAL ( and which therefore are not included in the table appended to the aforementioned decree of CARDINAL DATE ) .

CARDINAL . At the material time , the table was construed differently by different courts . Thus , as the parties have noted , the order made on DATE by the President of the GPE tribunal de grande instance contradicted an order made DATE ( on DATE ) by the President of the GPE tribunal de grande instance .

CARDINAL . In an order of CARDINAL DATE , the President of the PERSON tribunal de grande instance ruled that legal aid could not be refused to a person charged with a Class CARDINAL minor offence simply because the table appended to LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE only provided for assistance to be given to the accused in the police court in connection with Class CARDINAL minor offences .
